summary: Remove authentication/sign-in gating so users can access the app directly without any sign-in screen; additionally remove Admin vs Client role distinctions and role-based onboarding so the app is a single shared experience for everyone.
architectural_notes: Bubble app with SaaS multi-tenant privacy rules: users restricted to their agency/leads; role-based access (Admin vs Team).
Core data types to implement in Bubble: User, Lead, Outreach Activity, Deal, Daily Task (plus later Service/Project for Agency OS upgrades).
Outreach Activity events (Sent/Replied) should be the source of truth for analytics (reply rate, outreach counts by platform).
OpenAI API integration for AI message generation, service recommendation, and proposal generation; store API key per user/agency for scalability.
Workflow rules: Deal Won updates user Total Revenue; Follow-up Date triggers “due today” notifications; analytics update must be immediate/consistent.
UI architecture: reusable components (cards, chart blocks, progress bars) and responsive sidebar navigation in teal/black/white theme.

Authentication direction change: support sign-in via mobile number or email (e.g., password or OTP), and ensure first-login profile creation/onboarding still occurs; re-evaluate any Internet Identity assumptions in auth and user model.

OTP login in Bubble requires external delivery (SMS/email) via third-party providers (e.g., Twilio/Sinch/MojoAuth); implementation depends on account email being enabled and/or an SMS plugin/API being configured.
Support separate onboarding flows by role: Admin flow (restricted/allowlisted) vs Client flow (service selection + pricing/details capture) after authentication.

If authentication is removed, the app becomes effectively public/no-auth; revisit multi-tenant privacy rules and data ownership since user/agency scoping cannot be enforced without a logged-in identity.
known_issues: OTP sign-in cannot be completed until an email sending method is enabled and/or an SMS provider/plugin is configured for the Bubble app.
Uploaded frontend static assets/images are not currently visible in the app UI; investigate asset bundling/paths/references and ensure they render in production.
Static images are still not visible in the app UI (user reports issue persists after build).

existing_features.title: Implement authentication using Internet Identity and create an app-level user profile record on first sign-in, capturing: name, email (optional), role (Admin/Team), agency name, monthly revenue goal, subscription plan, total revenue.
Enforce multi-tenant privacy rules: users can only access data belonging to their agency; role-based permissions (Admin vs Team) must be enforced in backend APIs and reflected in the UI.
Build the core application shell with a responsive sidebar navigation and routes for: Dashboard, Leads, Outreach, Services, Deals, Projects, Planner, Analytics, Settings.

Apply the requested visual design system across the app: minimal, teal + black + white, clean dashboard, beginner-friendly, mobile responsive; implement reusable UI components: Lead card, Stats card, Chart block, Progress bar.

Leads module: implement Leads page with add lead (manual), edit/delete, search, filter by niche/city/status, and a lead detail view that shows website, outreach history, AI scripts area, and follow-up reminders.
CSV bulk import: allow users to upload a CSV file, map columns to lead fields, validate rows, and bulk create leads with source set to CSV; show an import summary (created/failed).

Outreach module: implement Outreach page with tabs for Email, LinkedIn, Instagram, WhatsApp, SMS; for each lead support: generate message, mark Sent, mark Replied, schedule follow-up, and persist outreach activities.

Dashboard analytics: implement Dashboard page that shows dynamic stats and charts: total leads, total outreach, reply rate, calls booked (if available), closed deals, revenue, revenue goal progress; charts for outreach by platform, conversion funnel, revenue growth.

Deals module: implement Deals page with a Kanban board for statuses: Open, Proposal Sent, Won, Lost; allow dragging/moving deals between statuses and editing deal value/close date; when a deal becomes Won, add deal value to the user total revenue and update analytics.

Planner module: implement “30-Day Planner” with a button “Start 3000 Outreach Plan” that auto-creates 30 daily task records with default targets (40 Emails, 25 LinkedIn, 15 Instagram, 10 WhatsApp, 10 SMS); show progress bars, daily completion %, and a streak counter based on completion.
Notifications/badges: when a lead follow-up date is today, show a notification badge in the UI (global nav and/or leads/outreach views) and provide a quick view list of due follow-ups.
Services module: add a Services Dashboard page that lists all services with price, delivery time, total sales per service, revenue per service; allow add/edit service and toggle active/inactive.

Proposal generator: add a “Generate Proposal” action on the lead/deal flow that produces proposal content containing: problem analysis, service recommendation, pricing breakdown, delivery timeline, expected results, and CTA; allow export to PDF and create a shareable link.

Delivery/Projects module: implement a Projects page (“Client Delivery Tracker”) that lists delivery projects for sold services; each project supports: project start date, milestones, file uploads, client notes, completion %, and status updates.

Automation logic: implement the specified automated updates: increment platform counters when outreach sent; set lead status to Replied when replied; when lead status becomes Interested, generate/show 3 service suggestions; when deal becomes Won, auto-create a delivery project linked to the deal/service; when service/project is completed, create a “Request testimonial” notification item.

Revenue analytics upgrade: extend Analytics/Dashboard views to show revenue breakdowns by service, niche, city, and platform source; show best-selling service, highest margin service (based on configurable margin field or placeholder), average deal value, and close rate per service.

Scalability readiness: add settings UI and backend storage for per-user or per-agency API key storage (for future AI provider integration) and subscription plan field management (for future Stripe), without implementing Stripe payments.

Update the sign-in experience to accept an "Email or mobile number" identifier and then proceed with the existing Internet Identity authentication flow (do not remove Internet Identity). The entered identifier must be stored temporarily (e.g., in session/local storage) so it can be used during first-time profile setup.

Extend the first-time Profile Setup modal to capture a mobile number (optional) in addition to the existing email field, and prefill email or phone from the identifier entered on the sign-in screen when possible.
Display the saved mobile number in Settings → Profile Information (read-only), alongside the existing name/email/agency/role fields.

Do not implement OTP sign-in (SMS/email/passwordless). Keep Internet Identity as the only authentication method, and ensure the sign-in UI communicates that authentication continues via Internet Identity after entering an email/phone identifier.

Implement an admin-only first-time profile setup path that is restricted to the allowlisted admin identity details: name "Aryan Abhishek", phone number "+919182768591", and email "quickbeeagency@gmail.com". If the stored sign-in identifier matches the allowlisted email or phone, prefill the profile setup form with these values and force the role to Admin (not editable). If it does not match, prevent selecting Admin during profile setup.

Add a client onboarding flow (for non-admin users after Internet Identity sign-in) that lets the client browse/select a service and view detailed service information and cost details, then submit their selection as a persisted “client service request” linked to their principal and agency.

Provide an admin-facing view to review client service requests within the app (accessible only to Admin users), showing the client identifier (principal and/or submitted email/phone if present), selected service, and captured cost details.
Remove the sign-in requirement so the app loads directly into the main application routes without showing the SignInPage or requiring Internet Identity login.
Update the root routing/onboarding logic to stop blocking access based on `identity` and stop showing the first-time ProfileSetupModal as a prerequisite for accessing the app.
Adjust navigation and settings UX for a no-sign-in experience by removing or reworking sign-out-related UI so it does not appear or does not imply authentication is required.
Add a new “Export Data” UI section that lets users download app data with separately downloadable buttons for each format: PDF, DOCX, CSV (Google Sheets compatible), and Excel (.xlsx).

Implement exports for the key datasets available in the app (at minimum: Leads, Outreach Activities, Services, Deals, Projects) and ensure each export includes a clear header row/labels and consistent field ordering across formats.

Add the 14 user-uploaded image files to the frontend as static assets and standardize how they are referenced in the React UI (no backend image serving). Uploaded files: f25340160.jpeg, f25339648.jpeg, f5418752.jpeg, f25481216.jpeg, f25737216.jpeg, AI automation.png, discover & strategy.jpeg, DM ICON.png, f25741568.jpeg, deployment icon.png, f25737984.jpeg, f25726208.jpeg, f25639680.jpeg, f25731584.jpeg.

Incorporate the uploaded images into the UI in a cohesive way that improves perceived quality: use the icon-style images for platform affordances (Instagram/WhatsApp/Email/DM/Phone/Deployment/Automation), and use the illustration-style images as page hero/empty-state artwork where appropriate (e.g., Dashboard empty state, Planner introduction card, Outreach empty state cards).

Refine the overall visual styling to be “more elegant” while keeping the existing minimal teal/black/white design direction: improve typography hierarchy, spacing, card/panel styling, and interactive states (hover/focus), and align visuals across AppShell/SidebarNav and key content cards (StatsCard, ChartBlock, ExportDataSection).

Fix the visibility of the 14 uploaded static image assets across the app by ensuring the assets are correctly present in the frontend build output and that the current UI references render successfully in production (Planner, Dashboard empty state, Outreach empty states, Sidebar/AppShell logo).

Make Leads page actions functional by implementing working UI flows for: Add Lead, Import CSV, and Lead card click-through (to a lead detail view or modal) using existing backend APIs and hooks, and ensure state updates reflect immediately in the UI.

Make Outreach page functional by implementing end-to-end outreach activity creation and updates: allow selecting a lead, generating/entering a message per platform, saving the activity, and making “Mark Sent” / “Mark Replied” buttons persist changes and refresh analytics and lists.
Make Services page functional by wiring “Add Service”, “Edit Service”, and the Active/Inactive toggle to persist changes via backend APIs, and ensure the list refreshes correctly after mutations.

Make Deals page functional by implementing interactive deal management (at minimum: create/edit deal, update status across Open/Proposal Sent/Won/Lost) and ensure revenue-related analytics update when deals are marked Won.

Make Projects page functional by implementing a projects list that loads persisted projects, a “New Project” creation flow, and the ability to view and edit a project (milestones, notes, completion, status).

Add in-app image and file uploading support so users can upload attachments (images and common documents) and attach them to relevant records (at minimum: Projects; optionally Leads), and then view/download those attachments from the UI.
Make Planner page functional by wiring “Start 3000 Outreach Plan” to create and persist the 30 daily tasks/targets and render progress, completion %, and streak based on stored data.

Make Analytics and Settings pages function reliably under the current app access mode by preventing authorization traps from breaking page loads, and ensure each page displays meaningful states when the caller has no profile/agency context.

Fix frontend static asset bundling/serving so all 14 uploaded images render in production wherever referenced, including (but not limited to) Planner, Dashboard empty states, Outreach empty states, and Sidebar/AppShell logo areas.
Remove Admin vs Client role-based UX so the app is a single shared experience for everyone: eliminate admin-only sections, client-only onboarding navigation, and any role-gated routing/UI.

Remove the Client Onboarding flow from the main app experience (route and navigation) so there is no separate client path; keep core routes focused on the main modules (Dashboard, Leads, Outreach, Services, Deals, Projects, Planner, Analytics, Settings).
Add the uploaded image file "qb logo.png" as a bundled frontend static asset and expose a stable URL for it (with correct URL encoding if needed).
Replace the current app logo image used in the sidebar and mobile header with the uploaded "qb logo.png" so the new logo renders consistently across the AppShell and SidebarNav.
Update the browser tab icon (favicon) to use the uploaded "qb logo.png" (or a derived favicon-compatible variant) so the app branding matches the new logo.

Remove any remaining role-based or identity-based UI gating so every user can navigate to and use every main section of the app (Dashboard, Leads, Outreach, Services, Deals, Projects, Planner, Analytics, Settings) without being blocked, redirected, or shown a “blocked” state.

Update Settings page behavior to work in public/no-sign-in mode: if the caller profile cannot be loaded (missing identity or missing profile record), render a non-blocking guest-friendly state (e.g., show 'Guest' and 'Not set' values) and do not require completing profile setup to access Settings content.

Remove admin allowlist / admin-locked profile setup behaviors from the active user experience so the app does not treat any user differently based on role; do not force, lock, or hide options based on allowlisted identifiers.

Fix serving/bundling of the uploaded static image assets so they render reliably in production wherever referenced (Sidebar/AppShell logo, Dashboard empty state, Planner cards, Outreach empty states, and favicon).

Make uploaded image URL resolution robust to non-root deployments by avoiding hardcoded absolute paths (leading "/") for uploaded images and favicon, while keeping correct URL encoding for filenames with spaces and special characters.
Add a user-visible, non-technical fallback for failed image loads in key placements (logo and empty-state/hero images) so the UI remains usable even if an image cannot be fetched.

Create a new modern, minimal, mobile-first “Services & Pricing” page for the digital agency “Quick Bee AI Growth Engine” using a teal and black theme, with a premium-but-affordable look (rounded cards, subtle shadows, smooth hover animations, and a comparison-style layout).

On the new “Services & Pricing” page, render exactly 5 productized service categories (Quick Website Launch, WhatsApp Automation System, Lead Machine Setup, Personal Brand Starter Kit, Mini AI Growth Kit), each with three pricing tiers (Basic, Pro, Premium) showing INR prices and the provided bullet-point features for each tier.

Add a “Monthly Maintenance Plans” toggle/section on the “Services & Pricing” page with Student ₹499/month, Business ₹999/month, and Pro ₹1,999/month, and show the included bullets: Minor updates, Basic support, System monitoring.
Add CTA buttons under every tier/package on the “Services & Pricing” page: a visible “Select Plan” button and a visible “Get Started” button for each package.
Add an FAQ section at the bottom of the “Services & Pricing” page addressing: delivery time, payment options (UPI, Razorpay, Stripe), and support, using English user-facing text.
Add a navigable route to the new “Services & Pricing” page and expose it in the app navigation without removing the existing “Services” management page.

Update the Services management UI to capture and display the new Service metadata fields (service type, sub-type, cost, niche, date, time) when adding/editing services, and format displayed currency as INR (₹) where prices/costs are shown.
Allow guest (no-sign-in / no-profile) users to view and update Settings without encountering authorization traps, and persist those updates reliably.
Remove guest-only UI restrictions that prevent guests from managing services, so guest users can add and edit services from the Services management page.

Add the provided services catalog entries into the app as Services records, grouped under the following serviceType categories: “Website & Funnel Services”, “AI & Automation Services”, “Marketing & Growth Systems”, “High-Ticket Business Solutions”, and “Bonus High-Value Add-ons (Optional Upsells)”.

new_feature_requests.summary: Set project name to “Quick Bee AI Growth Engine”
Bubble database schema: User, Lead, Outreach Activity, Deal, Daily Task data types with specified fields
Dashboard: key stats + charts (outreach by platform, conversion funnel, revenue growth) and revenue goal progress
Leads module: add/edit/delete, search/filter, CSV bulk import, lead detail panel with outreach history, AI scripts, follow-up reminders
Outreach module: tabs by platform (Email/LinkedIn/Instagram/WhatsApp/SMS), generate AI message, mark sent/replied, schedule follow-ups; updates dashboard analytics
AI Message Generator using OpenAI API to generate personalized messages per channel with copy/regenerate
30-Day Planner: “Start 3000 Outreach Plan” creates 30 days with default daily targets, progress bars, completion %, streak counter
Deals module: Kanban board (Open/Proposal Sent/Won/Lost) with auto-calculated revenue
Workflow automation: increment platform counters on sent; set lead status to Replied on reply; add deal value to user total revenue on Won; notification badge for follow-ups due today
SaaS structure: privacy rules (users see only their leads), role-based access (Admin/Team), subscription plan field (future Stripe)
UI/UX: minimal teal/black/white, clean beginner-friendly responsive dashboard, sidebar nav, reusable components (lead/stat/chart/progress)
Services page: services dashboard with price, delivery time, total sales, revenue per service; add/edit; active/inactive toggle
Lead detail upgrade: AI suggested services, assign service dropdown, show estimated revenue, probability %, expected close value
AI Service Recommender: analyze website/niche/social presence via OpenAI to suggest best services
Proposal Generator: AI creates problem analysis, service recommendation, pricing, timeline, expected results, CTA; export PDF + shareable link
Revenue analytics upgrade: breakdown by service/niche/city/platform source; best-selling/highest margin service; avg deal value; close rate per service
Delivery management: Client Delivery Tracker/Projects section with milestones, file uploads, client notes, completion %
Automation additions: on Lead Interested suggest 3 services; on Deal Won auto-create delivery project; on service completed request testimonial; revenue updates dashboard instantly
Scalability prep: Stripe integration readiness, team members under agency, per-user OpenAI API key storage, lead scoring algorithm, future automation triggers

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for: Leads, Outreach Activities, Deals, Daily Tasks (30-day plan), Services, Proposals, and Delivery Projects (client delivery tracker), including all fields specified by the user.

Lead detail upgrade: add a “Suggested Services (AI recommended)” section showing up to 3 suggested services; allow “Assign Service” via dropdown and display estimated revenue, probability %, and expected close value once assigned.
Add mobile number storage to the backend user profile and registration flow so the profile can persist an optional phone number alongside the existing email field.
Remove sign-in/authentication requirement and allow direct access to the app (no sign-in screen); update routing/onboarding accordingly

Make backend APIs usable without requiring Internet Identity authentication by removing/relaxing backend permission checks that currently trap for unauthenticated callers, so the app functions in a public/no-auth mode.
Align data-scoping logic with direct-access mode by ensuring backend filtering that depends on an existing `UserProfile`/agency does not result in empty data or authorization traps for guest users.
Add separate export/download buttons for key app data in multiple formats (PDF, DOCX, CSV/Excel, Google Sheets-compatible) so files can be manually shared via WhatsApp
Add or extend backend query APIs as needed to support exporting Deals and Projects data in no-auth/direct-access mode without trapping for unauthenticated callers.
Update UI to incorporate the provided images and refine visual styling to a more elegant look (polish layout/spacing/typography to match).
Add in-app image upload support (e.g., attach/upload images to relevant records such as Leads/Projects) with UI controls and storage handling appropriate for no-auth mode
Add in-app data/file uploading options (beyond existing CSV import/exports) so users can upload and attach documents/data files where relevant (e.g., Projects/Proposals/Leads)

Make Client Onboarding flow functional by ensuring service browsing works without broken dependencies, request submission persists, and the user can see their submitted requests; avoid hard dependency on agency/profile values that may be missing and handle missing context gracefully.
Remove Admin/Client role distinctions and related onboarding/allowlist logic; make the app a single shared experience for all users (no role-based views/permissions).

Update backend access control behavior so backend APIs do not enforce Admin vs Client distinctions and do not trap due to missing role/profile in the current no-sign-in/direct-access mode; all users should be treated uniformly for purposes of using the app.
Set the provided image as the app logo (update Sidebar/AppShell logo to use this image consistently across the UI).
Ensure all users have full access to every section of the app (including Settings) with no role-based restrictions or gating in the current no-sign-in/direct-access mode.

Ensure backend APIs do not trap or deny access due to missing identity/profile/role in the current public/no-sign-in mode, including Settings-related profile queries and any data needed to render each page.

Align backend data-access behavior with “everyone can access everything” by removing/relaxing multi-tenant/agency scoping requirements that prevent users from seeing data when they do not have an agency context (e.g., analytics queries that require an agency parameter).

Create a modern, minimal, mobile-first Services & Pricing page (teal/black theme) for “Quick Bee AI Growth Engine” showing 5 productized service categories with Basic/Pro/Premium INR tiers, features, delivery/support details, CTAs (“Select Plan”/“Get Started”), a Monthly Maintenance Plans toggle (Student/Business/Pro pricing), and an FAQ (delivery time, payment options incl. UPI/Razorpay/Stripe, support); also include/track service metadata fields: service type, sub-type, cost, niche, date, time.

Extend the backend Service data model to store additional metadata fields: service type, sub-type of service, cost, niche, date, and time; update service creation/update logic to persist these fields and return them from service query endpoints.
Allow guest (no-sign-in) users to edit/change Settings (remove any remaining restrictions/gating on Settings mutations in public mode).

Add new Services catalog entries under categories: Website & Funnel Services, AI & Automation Services, Marketing & Growth Systems, High-Ticket Business Solutions, and Bonus Add-ons (Optional Upsells) using the provided service list.
Add payment gateway offerings under services/add-ons, including International Payment Gateway Setup (Stripe, PayPal) and Indian Payment Gateway Integration (Razorpay, UPI).
Relax backend authorization checks for service creation and service updates so they work in public/no-sign-in mode (guests), without trapping.
